name: territorially
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates to an area that an animal or person tries to control or thinks belongs to them : The wild chimps are territorially aggressive and would probably kill the orangutans. Liverpool dominated the pitch territorially and produced occasional flashes of brilliance.
in a way that relates to an area of land, or sometimes sea, that is considered as belonging to, or connected with a particular country, group, or person : The indigenous inhabitants of Australia were territorially defined into about 600 distinct groups when the first Europeans occupied the continent. None of the five areas is linked territorially.
More examplesFewer examplesCertain tropical fish are said to be more territorially inclined than others.We draped our jackets and belongings territorially over the seats that we had claimed.They argue that it may be necessary to strengthen some nations, both territorially and strategically.
